Virtual Reality Film Festival: Create an immersive experience by screening films in virtual reality. Invite filmmakers to submit VR-compatible films and provide VR headsets for attendees to fully immerse themselves in the cinematic experience. Confidence score: 0.8

Pop-Up Film Festival: Organize a series of secret screenings in unexpected locations around the city, such as rooftops, parks, or abandoned buildings. Create a sense of mystery and intrigue by only revealing the location of each screening a few hours before the showtime. Confidence score: 0.9

Interactive Film Festival: Incorporate audience participation by creating interactive elements throughout the festival. For example, attendees could vote on their favorite film, or participate in live polls and Q&A sessions with the filmmakers. Confidence score: 0.8

Film Scavenger Hunt: Organize a scavenger hunt that takes attendees on a tour of the city, visiting different filming locations from famous movies and TV shows. At each location, attendees could watch a short film or clip, and then move on to the next location. Confidence score: 0.7

Themed Film Festival: Choose a specific theme, such as "Films of the Future" or "Cinema of the Past," and invite filmmakers to submit films that fit within that theme. Create a unique atmosphere by decorating the screening venue to match the theme, and hosting a costume contest for attendees to dress up as their favorite film characters. Confidence score: 0.8
